description: Several laws should be rewritten to better protect people's privacy, the constitutional court says.
title: Germans hand police too much data, court rules
title_page: Germans hand police too much data, court rules - BBC News
maintext: One of the two lawsuits was filed to the court in 2013 by European Pirate party politicians Patrick Breyer and Katharina Nocun who had the backing of 6,000 people. They complained police were given access to data such as email passwords and PIN numbers in relatively minor investigations.
